lines.text: I built my whole life on hating my father. All the time he was inside me, laughing.
Can't you say "Yes, sir" without makin' it sound like an insult?
Yes, sir.
You're gettin' too superior, McLeod, a one-man army against crime. What's eatin' you?
I hate criminals. I don't believe in coddling them.
At an autopsy the other day I watched the medical examiner saw off the top of a man's skull, take out the brain and hold it in his hand.
[holds out his hand]
Like that.
Why are you telling me this?
Because I'd give my soul to take out my brain, hold it under the faucet and wash away the dirty pictures you put there tonight.
Dirty pictures?
Yes!

Oh, I see. I see. Yes, that would be fine... if we could. But when you wash away what I may have put there, you'll find you've a rotten spot in your brain, Jim. And it's growing. I know, I've watched it.
I wanna put him in the electric chair where he belongs, and pull the switch myself.
Take a couple of drop dead pills.
You shouldn't drink so much. It melts the lining of your brain.
Where's your boy?
[Asking about Karl Schneider]
He's ready to surrender himself on the warrant you had issued.
Fine. Bring him in.
Before I do, I have here some photographs. Now these were taken only an hour ago.
Nudes. Ugly, isn't he?
He's no Mr. America.
No, that he's not.
Now you'll observe there are no bruises or lacerations of any kind. This is the way I'm delivering my client to you, and this is the way I want him back.
I should think that any change whatsoever would be an improvement.
I ought to fall on you like the sword of God.
That sword has two edges. You could cut your own throat.

I'm going to give you a piece of advice, Karl. When they let you free again, get out of New York. You butcher one more patient and law or no law, I'll find you. I'll put a bullet in the back of your head, and I'll drop your body in the East River. And I'll go home and I'll sleep sweetly.
You don't frighten me. Now I'll give you some advice. I have plenty on you, too. I know why you're so vindictive.
Why?
Just watch your step. Because I happen to have friends, downtown, with pull.
Have you?
Lots of pull.
Well, what do you know? Aren't you the big shot? Pull. Have you got any friends with push, like that?
[Shoves him and begins slapping him]

[leaving the office]
Mind if I shave?
Gotta have the last word, don't ya?
